The following was logged while shuting down (I believe the buidl was I20050526 
but it may have been an early nightly as well).

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.DataArea.getLogLocation(DataArea.java:64)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.getLogFileLocation(Platform.java:634)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.logging(LogView.java:565)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform$2.run
(InternalPlatform.java:850)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:1038)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.log
(InternalPlatform.java:853)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.log(Worker.java:48)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:85)

InternalPlatform.frameworkLog is set to null on shutdown.  This is another case
where behaviour of Platform API methods is undefined after runtime has shut
down.  If it's not possible to compute the log location after shutdown, I guess
we should throw IllegalStateException() to avoid the NPE.

John suggested that "Worker.run should check if the platform is shutdown and not
try to log".
Fine polish item.
CCing DJ for RC2 fix approval.
